message_1: What is the minimum detectable activity of a gamma-ray detector with an efficiency of 20% for a radioactive sample that has a specific activity of 200 Bq/g?
message_2:
To find the minimum detectable activity (MDA) of a gamma-ray detector, we need to consider the efficiency of the detector and the specific activity of the radioactive sample.

Efficiency (ε) = 20% = 0.20
Specific activity (A_s) = 200 Bq/g

The minimum detectable activity (MDA) can be calculated using the following formula:

MDA = A_s / ε

MDA = 200 Bq/g / 0.20

MDA = 1000 Bq/g

The minimum detectable activity of the gamma-ray detector is 1000 Bq/g.
